publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3408 Robin Harper: Soil Association Report on GM Crops-That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to examine the findings of the recent report by the Soil Association, Seeds of Doubt - North American Farmers' Experiences of GM Crops, paying particular attention to the impact of genetically modified crops on conventional and organic farming, and to hold a full public consultation on the growing of genetically modified crops that addresses the concerns raised in the report.
S1M-3408 Soil Association Report on GM Crops (lodged on 18 September 2002) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-3408 Robin Harper: Soil Association Report on GM Crops-That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to examine the findings of the recent report by the Soil Association, Seeds of Doubt - North American Farmers' Experiences of GM Crops, paying particular attention to the impact of genetically modified crops on conventional and organic farming, and to hold a full public consultation on the growing of genetically modified crops that addresses the concerns raised in the report. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan
S1M-3408 Soil Association Report on GM Crops (lodged on 18 September 2002) Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-3408 Soil Association Report on GM Crops (lodged on 18 September 2002) Roseanna Cunningham*
S1M-3408 Soil Association Report on GM Crops (lodged on 18 September 2002) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-3408 Soil Association Report on GM Crops (lodged on 18 September 2002) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3408 Soil Association Report on GM Crops (lodged on 18 September 2002) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-3408 Soil Association Report on GM Crops (lodged on 18 September 2002) Irene McGugan*
S1M-3408 Soil Association Report on GM Crops (lodged on 18 September 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*
